results.title: Pop & op art
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History through art”.
Surveys the two art movements known as pop and op art, showing examples from the work of pop and op artists, quoting their expressed intentions and attitudes, and comparing pop and op art with earlier art movements.

results.title: Pop-Up Television Radio Model TR-475U
results.material_description: plastic body with silver metal handle, trim and antenna.
results.brief_description:
National Transistor TV. Model TR-475U. Pop-up screen and pull out handle for portablity.
No power cords, batteries only.

Brand: National

Serial no. F 3 (??) 1113
TQF8125

National Transistor TV
Model TR-475U DC12V 11W
Matsushita Electric Industrial Co. Ltd
Made in Japan
TBM 81685

Caution: To prevernt electric shock, do not remove cover. No user-serviceable parts inside, and pilot lamp soldered in place. Refer servicing to qualified service personnel.

Note: Before opening the pop-up portion of this TV. Please release two red screws fixed on the bottom side of the set. These screws are fixed for delivery safety only. The battery enclosed in this TV receiver is disconnected to assure longer life.

Before use, it must be properly connected. Please see instruction manual. For longer battery life: charge more than 10 hours before initial use. After each use once a month.

There are no power cords accompanying the TV.
results.description:
The National Transistor TV Radio Model TR-475U is a battery-operated, portable model features an inbuilt radio and a ‘pop-up’ television screen.
National was a brand used by Panasonic Corporation sell home appliances, personal appliances, and industrial appliances. The National brand operated in Australia until 1988 when it transferred to The Panasonic Corporation.

results.title: Poor man's orange (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Anthony Buckley, Anthony Buckley Productions, Quantum Films and George Whaley
results.brief_description: Television dramatisation of the second of Ruth Park’s novels covering the trials and tribulations of the poor Irish-Australian Darcy family of number 12 1/2 Plymouth Street in Surrey Hills - a Sydney slum. In this series it is the 1950’s and all the Darcy children have grown up yet they still have to face the problems of their working class background.

results.title: Poor Man's Cinema
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Filmstruck Series”.
It’s what countries like Australia produce - documentaries! John Baxter, well-known Australian film historian and cinema critic, looks at the renaissance of the ‘60s as well as the Hollywood wartime documentaries, and their effect on the evolution of cinema.

results.title: Poor Cow
results.creator_credit: Joseph Janni, Anglo Amalgamated and Kenneth Loach
results.brief_description: Scripted by Nell Dunn from her novel, “Poor Cow” is a gritty piece of social realist film-making. A young woman is left pregnant and living in poverty when her husband is taken to jail. She begins a relationship with his best friend but though she attempts to negotiate the radical sexual mores of late-sixties London her lack of material resources, and the two men’s lack of consideration for her own feelings, eventually lead to her unhappiness. Powerfully directed by Ken Loach, “Poor Cow” is often a stinging critique of “swinging London” as seen through the eyes of working class people. With Carol White and Terence Stamp.

results.title: Pooling around
results.creator_credit: Continental Oil Company and Paul Galan
results.brief_description: Looks at a van pool commuter program established by the American firm Conoco. With the aim of energy conservation, employees commute to work in a van. Shows the beneficial aspects for the company and the employees.
results.description: Looks at a van pool commuter program established by the American firm Conoco. With the aim of energy conservation, employees commute to work in a van. Shows the beneficial aspects for the company and the employees.

results.title: Pool sharks
results.creator_credit: Essex Films, Gaumont-British Instructional and Edwin Middleton
results.brief_description: W.C. Fields’ first film displaying his prowess at the pool table; rivals for the same girl find that a “friendly” game does not help to settle the matter. A useful comparison with later films in terms of the development of character, history of comedy and the role of women. Written by W.C. Fields and musical score by Stuart Oderman.

results.title: Pool Party – Julia Jacklin
results.brief_description: Intoxicated detachment is the mood most easily evoked in singer/songwriter Julia Jacklin’s music video for ‘Pool Party’ (2016). Featuring her drummer Tom Stephens as the co-star, it recalls a distinct 70s aesthetic with an Australian twist as it was filmed in Jacklin’s hometown, the Blue Mountains.
results.description: Intoxicated detachment is the mood most easily evoked in singer/songwriter Julia Jacklin’s music video for Pool Party (2016). Featuring her drummer Tom Stephens as the co-star, it calls to a distinct 70s aesthetic with an Australian twist as it was filmed in Jacklin’s birthplace, the Blue Mountains. As hypnotic as it is uncomfortable, it follows two characters as they struggle to meet in the middle visually, physically, and lyrically.
description_for_label: Intoxicated detachment is the mood most easily evoked in singer/songwriter Julia Jacklin’s music video for Pool Party (2016). Featuring her drummer Tom Stephens as the co-star, it calls to a distinct 70s aesthetic with an Australian twist as it was filmed in Jacklin’s birthplace, the Blue Mountains. As hypnotic as it is uncomfortable, it follows two characters as they struggle to meet in the middle visually, physically, and lyrically.

results.title: Pool of contentment
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Richard Massingham
results.brief_description: Explains how a typing pool operates in a British Government Department; points out common faults on the part of officers giving dictation or sending drafts to bee typed; suggests remedies for these faults, also ways in which typists may attain greater efficiency.
